definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to do things in a strictly businesslike manner (idiom)

sentences.english: I wasn’t satisfied with this routine.
sentences.chinese: 我不滿意這一例行公事。

sentences.english: Zen monks create routines to allow themselves to work more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 禪僧建立例行公事使他們工作更有效率。

sentences.english: He carried a leather briefcase embossed with his initials.
sentences.chinese: 他帶着一個飾有浮凸的姓名首字母的皮公事包。

sentences.english: The mayor did not look at him, but went on annotating this docket .
sentences.chinese: 市長先生不望他，仍舊批他的公事。

sentences.english: It's not only a daily routine.
sentences.chinese: 它可不只是每天的例行公事哦。

sentences.english: E. g. I'm not officially supposed to be here.
sentences.chinese: 按公事說，我是不該到這裏來的。

sentences.english: Don’t confound public affairs with private ones.
sentences.chinese: 不要把公事與私事混爲一談。

sentences.english: Ross and Rachel begin dating. One of their dates is interrupted when Ross is paged to the museum.
sentences.chinese: 羅斯和瑞秋約會，卻因公事被召回博物館。

sentences.english: Do you think my briefcase is big enough to put in all these stuff?
sentences.chinese: 你覺得我的公事包夠裝所有這些東西嗎？

sentences.english: Access to space is neither easy, nor routine.
sentences.chinese: 太空旅行既不容易也非例行公事。

sentences.english: In the past, raising the debt ceiling was routine.
sentences.chinese: 過去提高國債上限是例行公事。

sentences.english: I usually put my car key in the briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 我通常都是把車鑰匙放在公事包裏的。

sentences.english: Prison life consists of routine and then mort routine.
sentences.chinese: 監獄生活充斥了一段又一段地例行公事。

definition: to do things in a strictly businesslike manner (idiom)
(political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
to show an interest in/to get involved with
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
